This page is currently under construction!
Calculation Types
The Sabrix Solution currently offers the three following Calculation Types:

Forward (where the Gross Amt is passed in)
Reverse from Tax (where Tax Amt is passed in)
Reverse from Total (where a combined Gross Amt and Tax Amt are passed in as a Total amount).
Forward:
Gross Amt is passed in. The Tax Amt is arrived at by (1) passing in the Gross Amt and multiplying by the applicable Rate(s), which are based on the Authority determined through the evaluation of other variables passed into the calculation, to arrive at the Tax Amt. The Total is calculated as (2) the Tax Amt plus the Gross Amt.

Calculation Steps:
Gross Amt * Rate(s) = Tax Amt
10000.00 * 0.08 = 800.00
Tax Amt + Gross Amount = Total
800.00 + 10000.00 = 10800.00
Examples:
Workbench Scenario and Tax Calculation Results
xmlInput
Reverse from Tax
Tax Amt is passed in. Total is arrived at by (1) dividing the Tax Amt by the applicable Rate(s), which are based on the Authority determined through the evaluation of other variables passed into the calculation, and (2) adding the Total to the Tax Amt to arrive at the Total. Note: Gross Amt can be passed in with the Tax Amount, but may be overridden by the calculated Total.

Calculation Steps:
Tax Amt / Rate(s) = Sub-total
500.00 / 0.08 = 6250.00
Subtotal + Tax Amt = Total
6250.00 + 500.00 = 6750.00
Examples:
Workbench Scenario and Tax Calculation Results
xmlInput
Reverse from Total
A combinination of the Gross Amt and Tax Amt are passed in as the Total. The Gross Amt is arrived at (1) adding 100% to the applicable Rate(s), which are based on the Authority determined through the evaluation of other variables passed into the calculation, and (2) dividing the Total by the adjusted Rate(s). The Tax Amt is calculated by (3) multiplying the Gross Amt by original, non-adjusted Rates(s). The Gross Amt plus the Tax Amt will add up to the Total (4). The Eff Rate is arrived at by (5) dividing the Tax Amt by the Gross Amt.

Calculation Steps:
Rate(s) + 100% = Sub-total
0.08 + 1.00 = 1.08
Total / Sub-total = Gross Amt
20000.00 / 1.08 = 18518.52
Gross Amt * Rate = Tax Amt
18518.52 * 0.08 = 1481.48
Gross Amt + Tax Amt = Total
18518.52 + 1481.48 = 20000.00
Tax Amt / Gross Amt = Eff Rate
1481.48 / 18518.52 = 0.0799999136 (0.08)
Examples:
Workbench Scenario and Tax Calculation Results
xmlInput

fields.description:
Hello, Please retest following macros: ---------------------------- This is OK:
name="object$generalUtil.base64Encode( $body )"
$generalUtil.base64Encode( $body )

This is error:
onClick="document.object$generalUtil.base64Encode($body).style = 'color: red;';"
$generalUtil.base64Encode( $body ).x ---------------------------- I define as User macro. My output (call as: {general}šš body šš{general}): ---------------------------- This is OK: name="objectxaHFoSBib2R5IMWhxaE=" xaHFoSBib2R5IMWhxaE= This is error: onClick="document.object$generalUtil.base64Encode($body).style = 'color: red;';" $generalUtil.base64Encode( $body ).x ---------------------------- Problem is dot apendix (after parenthesis on line 6 and 7). I tested on 1.4-RC2 #209 and 1.4.2 Build:#214.
fields.summary: User macro - function call - error parser

fields.description: When trying to add space permissions via the remote API, if a username is specified as the "remoteEntityName", instead of adding space-level permissions for the user, they are added for the group (despite the fact that the group doesn't exist).
fields.summary: Adding space permissions for a user via XML-RPC instead adds permissions for a gorup

fields.description:
- On that note, it would be nice to have a report (I guess it would be in the  
user's profile) to show pages which the user has been involved in  
which have been recently modified (would also make a good RSS feed).  
ie "Show me pages that I've edited / commented on which someone else  
has modified in the last 7 days".

Not sure how efficiently we can query all these things - perhaps have
'association types' in the system that have to be able to get all the
content that someone is associated with in one SQL query?   

interface UserContentAssociation {
  public Set getContentEntitysAssociatedWithUser(User user, 
                                                DateRange validDates);
}

Then you have 'commented', 'edited' association types, which should be
able to get the desired content objects in one SQL query?
fields.summary: Activity report for content a user has been involved with

fields.description: There should be a user preference to automatically add a notification for content that the user creates or edits.
fields.summary: Automatically watch pages I edit user preference

fields.description:
Each notification email should end with a footer like so:

"You are receiving this email because you have subscribed to notifications for [this page|the Foobar Space] on http://confluence.atlassian.com/ (_Unsubscribe_)."

The unsubscribe link should be tokenised in some way so login is not required to remove the notification (but the user is not logged in by clicking it).
fields.summary: Quick "Stop watching" footer in notification emails
Summary of comment thread in notification emails

fields.description:
- It would be awesome to be able to simply reply in my email client  
and add a comment. We'd need to setup some sort of email-to-page  
feature, but that would be truly killer for integration  
I think.

- I second this.  Not sure how it would work exactly for pages, but
comments should be much easier to integrate.  We just need to be forward
thinking so that it works for pages when we finally add this.
fields.summary: Reply link from notification emails

fields.description:
Do it like JIRA:

# Specifies the From: header format in notification emails. Default is of
# the form "John Doe (JIRA) <jira@company.com>".
# Available variables are ${fullname}, ${email} and ${email.hostname}
# If commented out, format is just 'jira@company.com'.
jira.email.fromheader.format = ${fullname} (JIRA)
fields.summary: Configurable sender for notification emails

fields.description:
After installing confluence for evaluation, I found that I could not access the administration panels from the links.  Any attempt to do so gives "page not found" with the confluence site search panel being displayed.

Most everything else works just fine.  This has happened with both the embedded DB, and MySql.  All of the space/page creation/editing seems to be working, but I would like to access the admin panels...

I have browsed the various support forums on your website, and nothing jumped out at me as a solution to my problem...

Any help you can give will be appreciated.

Thanks.

Tim
fields.summary: Cannot access administration panels

fields.description:
Add an option to generate Atom 0.3 feeds.

Once Rome supports Atom 1.0, we should remove all 0.3 feeds from Confluence and replace them with 1.0
fields.summary: Support Atom 0.3
Access keys for hierarchy navigation

fields.description: Currently our documentation around extending Confluence is a little weak, and contains many assumptions. We need to improve our documentation around extending Confluence to make doing rather complex things (i.e. not out of the box) as easy as possible. With more detailed walk throughs and examples we'll see more people integrating, extending and embeding Confluence deeper into their environments.
fields.summary: Improve 'extending Confluence' documentation

fields.description:
We need to create a 'best practices' page exploring how people set up Confluence within their companies - exploring what are the best ways to setup spaces, pages, permissions etc. This page should also encourage and allow discussion - there may be links into the Forums as well.

Jeff Whitehead (jw@shutterfly.com) would potentially be interested in sharing some ideas to help get the discussions started.

Charles firmly believes we need to start this with a straw model that users can then critique and use to start the thread of communications and ideas around this.
fields.summary: Create a Confluence best practices page
Log who reads a page

fields.description: On the "This page has been deleted" page, put a space-admin-only link to restore the page from the trash.
fields.summary: Provide direct undelete link on deleted page

fields.description:
We don't have a NativeJDBCExtractor for the Websphere datasource:

org.springframework.dao.DataAccessResourceFailureException: Could not create Oracle LOB; nested exception is org.s ringframework.dao.InvalidDataAccessApiUsageException: OracleLobCreator needs to work on oracle.jdbc.OracleConnection, not on class com.ibm.ws.rsadapter.jdbc.WSJdbcConnection - specify a corresponding NativeJdbcExtractor
org.springframework.dao.InvalidDataAccessApiUsageException: OracleLobCreator needs to work on oracle.jdbc.OracleConnection, not on class com.ibm.ws.rsadapter.jdbc.WSJdbcConnection] - specify a corresponding NativeJdbcExtractor

The current workaround is to not use datasources with Oracle under Websphere. Use Confluence's internal connection pooling (the direct JDBC connection option) instead.
fields.summary: Can not use an Oracle datasource with Websphere
dynamictasklist improvements

fields.description: Since the bug in 1.4.2 allows users to add multiple page notifications, 1.4.3 needs to handle this situation gracefully. At the moment, 1.4.3 fails at the dao level when multiple notifications are detected.
fields.summary: Need to handle multiple "watches" / "notifications" gracefully.

fields.description:
This might be something else, but since some 1.4-RC-version daily mail dont work for me.

Some previous version i couldnt even get the checkbox to stay checked.

I have not verified this in 1.4.2, sorry.

I have check backup-xml to see if i see anything odd, and i dont. Neather in db. But then again, i'm not sure what to look for.

If the rest of you have working daily mail, just close this and i'll try and figure out whats wrong with my site. All tests have been done with same dataset.

/Thomas
fields.summary: Daily mail broken for 1.4.1 (since some 1.4RC version)
Reassign ownership when deleting a user

fields.description: If I create a page and set it for restricted view, then people who have no permission to view the page, but who have set a watch on the whole space, receive a notification email that contains the content of the page.
fields.summary: Security issue with 'watching'
confluence:docs maven target does not create javadoc for the com.atlassian.renderer packages.

fields.description:
Mike:

The other thing to note (at least for me on FireFox) is taht when you go to a page on the extranet you get 3 (count them!) back links added?!

It means if you hit the back button, you go - WTF?
You hit it again - still WTF?
You hit it again - you go back.

Trippy - and not so good :)

fields.description:
I'd be interested in having the ability to include random quotes.  (like random chosen excerpts from a page).  Excerpts could be used instead of quotes.

The idea is you could have a page with a number of {quote} or {excerpt} blocks and the {include-randomQuote:Page} would bring up a random quote from that page each time.


If it's easier, instead of having all the quotes on one page, you could use the hierarchy to have {include-randomChild:Page}.    this would include a randomly chosen child of Page.  same idea.  (in this case most of the work is already done, all the functions are parts of other confluence content macros, so it should be easy)

fields.description:
Hi,

Mike Cannon-Brookes wrote:

> I know - good API, user and developer docs are probably our, uh, worst
> area of development at the moment.
>
> We are improving in this though! We've recently hired a technical
> writer in Sydney who is working on the user documentation area
> (exciting things to come here!) and we're moving down the road of
> hiring someone to take care of developer documentation (both in terms
> of tutorials / examples, and internal API docs).


Very nice, thanks!

> If there are any specific methods or classes you want documented,
> please just let us know and we'll document them on the 1.4.x stable
> branch and update the online API docs. This is quite a simple task to
> do.


Here's an ordered list (most essential first) of the classes and interfaces I've mostly been using:

  * Macro
  * PageManager
  * ContentEntityObject
  * BlogPost
  * Page
  * PageContext
  * SpaceManager
  * SpaceDescription
  * WikiStyleRenderer
  * RenderContext
  * UserAccessor

If possible, I'd like to see more docs for at least the following methods:

  * Macro.execute()
  * PageManager.getRecentlyAddedBlogPosts()
  * AbstractPage.getUrlPath()
  * SpaceDescription.getRealTitle()
  * SpaceDescription.getUrlPath()
  * WikiStyleRenderer.convertWikiToXHtml()
  * RenderContext.setSiteRoot()
  * RenderContext.setImagePath()
  * RenderContext.setAttachmentsPath()

Although in many cases the method names are quite self-explaining, I still needed a attempts before I got the semantic details (like the sort order of getRecentlyAddedBlogPosts and the base of getUrlPath) figured out.

Should I file Jira issues or contact the support email address when I run into similar doc issues in future?

BR,

Jukka Zitting

--

http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/mailinglist.jsp

fields.description:
When you register, your username (and perhaps also password) are made to lowercase before stored (username visible as lowercase in useradmin).

When a member try and log on using upper and lowercase, he will not be able to log on. So the user who thought he created a mixed case account cannot relogin. And the cookie that gets stored has (as it seems) mixed case at the time when the user register. So it will not allow the user back in.
He will not be able to get a new password ether until he is told to use lowercase only.

I might have set it up wrongly ofc, but i have tried it to the extent of my knowledge.

/Thomas

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3557].
  {panel}

Confluence supports the notion of hierarchy within a space only for pages, and not for blogs or mail archiving. The blog issue is noted elsewhere, but I wanted to record the suggestion of having a notion of anchoring the mail in a certain space.

Also, for enterprise use, it would be best if we could have a single email account for confluence, and it would have configuration rules (like procmail) that determines where to post the web mail archive. 

For example, we would set up one account on the mail server, and subscribe it to a number of mailing lists of interest. It would be able to distinguish between mailing lists.

Right now you pretty much need to set up a pop account per mailing list in order to really partition it (or I'm missing something).

fields.description:
I have done some work on the userlister macro plugin that I want to contribute back to you. The source code for the changes is in the attached .zip file.  Here is a summary of the changes:
 
1). The "online" parameter was not working at all.  This was due to a couple of problems:
 
UserListener.handleEvent was calling UserList.userLoggedIn() on both the LoginEvent and the LogoutEvent (UserList.userLoggedOut() was never getting called), so once someone logged in they would always be listed as logged in.
 
UserList.matchEligibleUsers was not working as intended.  Elements were being removed from the same list that was being iterated through, yielding unpredictable results in the resulting list. 
 
2). I wanted to be able to see visually all users' logged in state.  I enhanced userlister to show one of two icons beside the user name, depending on whether they are logged in or not. 
 
Let me know if you have any questions or if I forgot to send you something.
 

Scott Frederick
Airline Products Development
Sabre Airline Solutions
682-605-4666

  {panel}

>* The Wiki has a pretty decent notation system. I'm impressed.

>> * The Codehaus window that displays the full notation guide has no
>>    menu or toolbars, so it can't be printed (alas) and there
>>    is no way to bookmark it for future reference.

>> * When previewing edits to a Wiki page, the Codehaus Help Tips
>>    pane shows this:
>> 
>>      Linking:
>>        [title#anchor] » Link a page
>>        [dev:title#anchor] » In space with 'dev'
>>        [http://host.com] » Remote link
>>        [phrase@shortcut] » Shortcut
>>        Note: [alias|any_of_above_links] » Custom link title
>> 
>>    I couldn't make sense out of that until I parsed the whole
>>    list. Here's a description that I think is more easily
>>    read, although it is also longer:


Yeah, it's not very clear, I totally agree with you.


>>      Linking:
>>        [target] » link to target
>>        [phrase|target] » link phrase to target
>> 
>>      Web Targets:
>>        http://host.com » remote link
>>        #... » local anchor
>> 
>>      Wiki Targets
>>        [title#anchor] » Location in a page
>>        [dev:title#anchor] » Page in space 'dev'
>>        [phrase@shortcut] » Shortcut
>> 
>>    If the contents of that pane are in the Wiki itself, I can
>>    edit it. (But since my version is longer, I'd like to
>>    confirm that improves readability enough to be worth making
>>    the change.)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3532].
  {panel}

At present this is:

#confluence.home=/tmp/confluence

This has two problems:

1. Users who aren't familiar with property files don't remove the '#'
2. Users who just remove the '#' and use the default path '/tmp/confluence' end up with their data somewhere unsafe.

We should change it to:

confluence.home=

So that users are told to set a directory. We could have suggested values for various OSs in comments.
fields.summary: Change the default confluence.home line in confluence-init.properties

fields.description:
We expose java.util.Map in the remote API as arguments to methods such as search() and getRenderedContent(). While XML-RPC has a native hash type, SOAP doesn't, so SOAP toolkits don't know how to translate the Map into a SOAP object... with predictably bad results.

We need to replace all maps in the API with beans that have specific property getters and setters. This will necessarily be a breaking non-backwards-compatible change, so we'll have to rev a new version of the API (confluence-v2) as a separate plugin. To keep all the breaking API changes in the same place, we should also fix the overloaded methods (CONF-3877) problem at the same time. 

(Original description)

 Hi

In the remote API one can search using:

Vector search(String token, String query, Map parameters, int maxResults)

I am trying to invoke this from Visual Basic .NET and confess to be a bit new to all this and a bit stuck. I can see an object called Map in the object browser which is added along with the ConfluenceService. But I think this object cannot be instantiated - I suspect it is sort of abstract, as the reference.vb file indicates: Public MustInherit Class Map

So how do I populate this with the space keys I want to restrict the search to. I could subclass Map, but what methods should I add (I tried it - but it did not seem to work). I suspect in Java this would be trivial, but I am stuck in .NET.

Anyone got any ideas - code examples?

Thanks

Chorltan

fields.description:
This relates to issues CONF-1339.

If attachments can be viewed via WebDAV then it is possible to edit them directly from Word, Excel. If confluence could allow the user to open an attachment from the DAV server rather than downloading it and opening from a local temp folder then the user could save the attachment back to the server automatically by hitting "Save" in word.

If confluence is proxying the WebDAV requests then it should be able to apply standard confluence permissions to the DAV PUT command.
fields.summary: Support "Edit attachment via WebDAV"

fields.description: A resent upgrade to hibernate has solved the problem that is being handled by the PagePropertiesUgradeTask. So remove this upgrade task.
fields.summary: Upgrade from 1.3.5 on postgres fails with the property upgrade task.

fields.description:
Somewhere within confluence we are not closing files correctly. The result is that after period of time, "TOO MANY FILES OPEN" is the response we get when attempting to export a space using the Html exporter. Im sure that we would receive this error from other processes that attempt to open a file as well.

We need to track down when we are opening files, and ensure that they are closed in a consistent manor.
fields.summary: Unclosed file handles.

fields.description: Tasks such as the MailPollJob and the ReferralQueueFlushJob will be run many times concurrently if something (such as a lack of DB connections) makes them slow to complete.
fields.summary: periodic tasks can have multiple concurrent instances, when they should have only one

fields.description: In order to import an existing documentation repository, it would be great to be able to add attachments via the xml-rpc interface.
fields.summary: please add storeAttachment() or addAttachment() functionality to xml-rpc

fields.description:
We tried to display 100 1024x768 images (each about 1.2 MB in size) through the use of the gallery macro.

We did the following:
1. Attached the 100 1024x768-1.2MB images to a new page
2. Edited the page and added the gallery macro to the page content
3. Viewed the page to make sure the gallery macro was working
4. Sent out an e-mail to the company telling everyone to come view the photos on the page

About 100 or so users instantly hit the page and the servers CPU started to hum along at 99% usage for about 15 minutes before we decided to pull the page down so that the other processes on the server could get CPU time.

90% of the cpu usage was coming from the java process. We also noticed an increase in the CPU usage of mysql.
fields.summary: Gallery Macro Causes Confluence Server to Grind to a halt when displaying 100 1024x768 images to 100+ simultaneous users

fields.description:
When saving a newly created page, the wiki-text is rendered in the same transaction in which the page has just been saved. If the page contains an RSS macro pointing back at the same Confluence server, it is possible that the RSS query (running in a separate transaction) will block waiting for the page-saving transaction to be committed.

So far, we have only encountered this problem under DB2.

A workaround is to run Confluence at "Read Uncommitted" isolation level by adding the following line to confluence.cfg.xml:

<property name="hibernate.connection.isolation">1</property>

This problem is fixed in Confluence 1.4.3, after upgrading to 1.4.3 or later the configuration property should be removed.
fields.summary: Creating a page containing the RSS macro may cause the server to hang against DB2

The following error is reported: 

[sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] ERROR: value too long for type character varying(200)

fields.summary: MySQL OS_PROPERTYENTRY fix breaks upgrade for users with existing values in the "entity_key" column exceeding 200 characters in length

fields.description: We have a requirement to be able to retrospectively set the date of news posts.. For example, if we are recording the minutes of a meeting we want the date to be the date of the meeting. If we don't record the minutes on the day of the meeting then we can't do this at the moment.
fields.summary: Set the date when posting news

fields.description:
There pretty much seems to be one global blog per space. 

I would like blog posts to be more like pages in that they have parents / children, and thus we can filter blog posts based on position in the hierarchy.


(You can filter by date / time, but there isn't a great way to set up a team or department blog. Perhaps I did the wrong thing in setting up pretty much everything in one space, but based on informal user testing we found that to be much better-- the partitioned
namespaces were harder for less technical users to conceptualize)
fields.summary: Blog / news post preserving hierarchy placement
jepu

fields.description:
This interceptor's main purpose is to write the last and previous login dates for a particular user as they log in to Confluence. 

I remember when we ran some functional tests with multiple threads simulating concurrent users logging in, that there were issues in this class and I was forced to comment out the writing of these dates to allow the tests to proceed. 

A customer who setup Confluence against postgres 8 also had issues with this class. He's confluence instance was losing connections. As soon as he installed a patched version of this class with date writing commented out, he reported back that no database connections were lost. (http://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-1132)
fields.summary: Problems in ConfluenceLoginInterceptor
